result.execSummary:
All charges against Anthony L Cannon in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony L Cannon is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony L Cannon

records.addlTxt:
8:41 AM Defendant Anthony L Cannon in court.  Attorney Gerardo Antonio De Los Santos Jr in court for Anthony L Cannon.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  The State did not file the consolidation as the defendant is only going to plea to 2 cts. of felony bail jumping in case 22CF937, the other 2 cases will be dismissed outright.  Upon plea to Cts. 3 and 4 in case 22CF937 the State would recommend CFTS on Ct. 3 and a period of probation on Ct. 4.  Defense was not aware the repeaters would be attached to the counts.  In the interest of going forward the State would move to strike the repeaters.  BTC: Repeaters on Cts. 3 and 4 stricken.  Court performs plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters his plea.  
Plea:
22CF937:
Ct. 3- GUILTY
Ct. 4- GUILTY
BTC: 
22CF923: DISMISSED OUTRIGHT. 
21cf1887: DISMISSED OUTRIGHT. 
22CF937:
Cts. 1-2- DISMISSED OUTRIGHT. 
Ct. 3- GUILTY, 57 days RCJ, CFTS applied, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge, FAW/Vote.  Payment plan of $50/month beginning on November 1, 2022.
Ct. 4- GUILTY, SENTENCE WITHHELD, 2 yrs. probation.
Ct. 5- DISMISSED OUTRIGHT. 

Conditions:
No contact with victim, B.M. 
No alcohol or controlled substances to be monitored by random UA's/breathalyzers.  AODA assessment and any follow through with any recommendations from agent.
Court Costs.
DNA Sample and Surcharge.
FAW/Vote.

Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski. Defense files a motion for joinder.  State concedes the motion.  These cases are resolved.  Parties ask for a plea/sent.  BTC: Jury trials removed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

State take no position at this time.  Defense makes argument on bond.  State is in Chapter 950 compliance.  State objects with argument.  BTC: Bond modification denied.
